comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142914#issuecomment-1433839152
The issue is cause by `Fanboy's Annoyances` and `EasyList Cookie List`, please add to your user rules: 
```
beta.character.ai#@#.modal
beta.character.ai#@#.modal-backdrop
```

Or turn off `Fanboy's Annoyances` and `EasyList Cookie List`.

comment.body:
Hello @AdamWr,

Thanks for the quick fix! Especially considering I currently don't have a valid French proxy for the very-restricted 6play. Only a French VPS + AdGuard VPN sub.

And, while it shares 99% of the code with _rtlplay.be_ (Belgium, so native access for me), I note after some tests that [my 'json-prune' rule](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/0c18c5e072279e6f228bdf29cda123f469e5c05e/FrenchFilter/sections/general_extensions.txt#L77) still works correctly there â€¦ while not anymore on _6play.fr_ after 14 months (according to these three reports [[1](https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/16905), [2](https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/16910), [3](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/143831)], all coming recently in a very short period of time). However, everything still exists, according to a 'json-prune' (in log mode).

**Therefore, would it be possible for you to try that?**
_(instead of removing properties, it set their values to false â€” like required for `tf1.fr`)_
<details>
<summary>Reveal rules â€¦</summary>

```adblock
! Disabling existing rules
6play.fr#@%#//scriptlet('json-prune', 'applaunch.data.player.features.ad.enabled applaunch.data.player.features.ad.dai.enabled', 'appName')
6play.fr#@%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'tv.freewheel.SDK.Util.pingURLWithForm', 'trueFunc')
6play.fr#@%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'tv.freewheel.SDK.Util.pingURLWithImage', 'trueFunc')
6play.fr#@%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'tv.freewheel.SDK.Util.pingURLWithScript', 'trueFunc')
6play.fr#@%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'tv.freewheel.SDK.Util.pingURLWithXMLHTTPRequest', 'trueFunc')
6play.fr#@%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'tv.freewheel.SDK.Util.sendAdRequestWithXMLHTTPRequest', 'trueFunc')
||vod.6cloud.fr/pub/*.mp4$media,redirect=noopmp3-0.1s,domain=6play.fr,badfilter
6play.fr#@%#//scriptlet('prevent-xhr', 'v.fwmrm.net/', 'true')
6play.fr#@%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'Object.prototype.isBlockerDetected', 'false')

! TESTING STUFF
! 1) Do this prevent "ads jingle" at start + "ads" (from any possible provider btw here, including their second one, smartX) + anti-adblock message, as before with my 'json-prune' rule?
! 2) If only AAB message is shown, is it OK after re-activating your AAB stuff found above in addition to this rule?
6play.fr#%#(function(){let callCounter=0;const nativeJSONParse=JSON.parse;const handler={apply(){callCounter++;const obj=Reflect.apply(...arguments);if(callCounter<=150){if(obj.hasOwnProperty('appName')){obj.applaunch.data.player.features.ad.enabled=false;obj.applaunch.data.player.features.ad.dai.enabled=false;}}else{JSON.parse=nativeJSONParse;}return obj;}};JSON.parse=new Proxy(JSON.parse,handler);})();
```
</details>

###### :arrow_right_hook: If functional, this one will be another possible candidate for a new trusted scriptlet allowing to set JSON value. :thumbsup:

##### _Thanks in advance!_

pull_request.title: Made a draft for a "foreign-cyrillic.txt" file in AdGuard Cyrillic Filter
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/144318

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

N/A

1. Your comment

Created my envisioning of one possible way to ensure long-term coverage of Cyrillic languages, modelled after AdGuard Base Filter's [foreign.txt](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/BaseFilter/sections/foreign.txt) file.

The Kyrgyz entries were copied from yesterday's issue report fixes, the Macedonian entries from foreign.txt, and the Mongolian entries from my proposals for not-yet-submitted issue reports planned for tonight or tomorrow at latest.

I also added a loose guess at a "Which languages does this file support?" section, with simple terminology in case there are list users with limited English skills.

I'll mark the PR as a draft soon after posting it, and the "Allow edits by maintainers" button has been turned on.

2. Screenshots

N/A

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
Hello,

Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce ads at the moment, even if I add just exclusion rules (`#@#` and `$badfilter`), so I cannot check out if this JS rule works or not.

>Oh, by the way, for AG products that do not support scriptlets (non-premium version on iOS, AdGuard Content Blocker), shouldn't `@mapx-'s` https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/16905#issuecomment-1442211699 be added (alongside [the scriptlet](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/aa41cb52f0214ab503d05f0faac7e9d1eb53d21f/FrenchFilter/sections/antiadblock.txt#L545))?

As I recall, I couldn't reproduce anti-adblock detection until ads were blocked, and ads are blocked only by added scriptlets/redirect rule(s), so products without scriptlets support shouldn't be affected.

comment.body:
>Seem to be a great pick for both FiltersRegistry (â€¦)

Turns out that https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DeepSpaceHarbor/Macedonian-adBlock-Filters/master/Filters has indeed been proposed for inclusion in AdGuard for several years, but was rejected in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/issues/354 for supposedly not being updated often enough. I wouldn't mind having that list be looked into for inclusion again.

Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
It looks like a paywall and we do not fix paywalls in filters.

I don't see any cookies created by this website, but it seems that it's related to `localStorage`.

Please add this rule:
```adblock
csmonitor.com#%#//scriptlet('set-local-storage-item', 'csm_unique_stories', 'emptyObj')
```
to user rules, it should reset this counter (at least it works fine on my end).

issue.body:
### Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. - [X] I am running the latest version - [X] I made sure all content blockers are enabled in Safari settings - [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer - [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed ### AdGuard version 1.11.11 ### Environment ```markdown - OS:Monterey 12.6.3 - Safari version: 16.3 (17614.4.6.11.6, 17614) ``` ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter ### Issue Details Steps to reproduce: 1. navigate to usatoday.com 2. observe warning / notification screen regarding ad-blocking (and that it must be disabled to view site) 3. ### Expected Behavior I expect to be able to read / view usatoday.com website ### Actual Behavior I get a warning screen about ad-blocker and cannot proceed to read or view website ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.sportsplays.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sportsplays.com%2F) ### Comment > I use sanitize, adblocker, together with adguard, .. it used to work fine before even with these extentions, and now disabled them. and use just adguard adblocker from ios. > This site uses a lot of watching video ads, before going to the next web page, perhaps by mgids or mgads, but adguard does block them from happening. I have been using adguard for more than at least 9 years or more. > and never have issues with it. > I always have in mind of buying adguard premium, but are afraid of these adblocker being detected. > My favorite feature of adguard is is the custom user rule, that I can add, but lately it is not functioning as before. > > I believe they just updated their rules by detecting adblockers with adguard. > Besides they updated completely to a newer website. > Meaning sanitize and adblocker is not the culprit here. .. > > All I have to disable is the General rule in adguard and it stops, the adblocker detected page of sportsplays.com, see photos, please. > the rest work fine like eliminating ads and video ads, ads comments by this website > Sorry for the long description explanations I hope it helps understanding the problem better. > > I like to use a lot of cosmetic filtering useless item on a webpage, like social media buttons comments and sports betting ads and recomendations. > The other website I use a lot is www.covers.com, but unable to block sports betting ads and recomendations. > Can you please check it out too, or do you need a separate report inquiry on this website? > Thank you for your attentions. Take care all the best. KenMitch ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.shuud.mn/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.shuud.mn%2F) ### Comment Username: @DandelionSprout > An ad in the upper left, and various placeholders. I propose: > ``` > ! http://www.shuud.mn/ (67,981th) > ! http://www.zaluucom.mn/ (134,324th) > ! https://www.24tsag.mn/ (179,460th) > .mn/banner^$subdocument,image > > ! http://www.shuud.mn/ > shuud.mn##div[class*=banner] > ``` > Can be added to Base Filter's foreign.txt while waiting for some kind of official Mongolian support in what I've understood to be plans for an "AdGuard Cyrillic Filter". > > The site was ranked 67,981th on Alexa according to https://dnpedia.com/tlds/topm.php ### Screenshots
